member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.AssemblyTraceSource`1
member.summary: Enable applications to trace the execution of code and associate trace messages with a source named after the assembly the generic type is from.

remarks.para: This class provides a way to automatically configure trace sources based on the target class (specifically naming the source after the assembly the class is from),which works well with dependency injection frameworks.

If using a dependency injection framework, by simply declaring a dependency of type ITraceSource`T and registering AssemblyTraceSource`T with the dependency injection container, classes will automatically get an ITraceSource based on their assembly name.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.ITraceSource`1
member.summary: Defines a set of methods and properties that enable applications to trace the execution of code and associate trace messages with a source related to a specific class.

remarks.para: The source is usually related to the specified class based on the class name or other properties, such as the assembly the class is from.
For a suitable default implementation, which bases the source on the assembly the class is from see AssemblyTraceSource.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.ITraceSource
member.summary: Defines a set of methods and properties that enable applications to trace the execution of code and associate trace messages with their source.

remarks.para: Using ITraceSource and TraceSourceWrapper, instead of directly using System.Diagnostics.TraceSource, may make testing easier in some cases by allowing the entire tracing infrastructure to by bypassed by using a stub or mock implementation.
Configuration using InMemoryTraceListener could achieve many of the same goals for testing, however using an interface may provide greater flexibility in some scenarios.

Using the derived generic interface also provides a way to automatically configure trace sources based on the target class (specifically naming the source after the assembly the class is from), which works well with dependency injection frameworks.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.ITraceSource.Close
member.summary: Closes all the trace listeners in the trace listener collection.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.ITraceSource.Flush
member.summary: Flushes all the trace listeners in the trace listener collection.

member.summary: Writes trace data to the trace listeners in the Listeners collection using the specified event type, event identifier, and trace data.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the event type of the trace data.
A numeric identifier for the event.
The trace data.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.ITraceSource.TraceEvent(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a trace event to the trace listeners in the Listeners collection using the specified event type, event identifier, and argument array and format.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the event type of the trace data.
A numeric identifier for the event.
A composite format string (see Remarks) that contains text intermixed with zero or more format items, which correspond to objects in the args array.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.TraceSourceWrapper
member.summary: Provides a wrapper around TraceSource that implements the ITraceSource interface, enable applications to trace the execution of code and associate trace messages with their source in a decoupled manner.

remarks.para: Using ITraceSource and TraceSourceWrapper, instead of directly using System.Diagnostics.TraceSource, may make testing easier in some cases by allowing the entire tracing infrastructure to by bypassed by using a stub or mock implementation.
Configuration using InMemoryTraceListener could achieve many of the same goals for testing, however using an interface may provide greater flexibility in some scenarios.

Using the derived generic interface also provides a way to automatically configure trace sources based on the target class (specifically naming the source after the assembly the class is from), which works well with dependency injection frameworks.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TraceSourceWrapper class, using the specified name for the source.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TraceSource class, using the specified name for the source and the default source level at which tracing is to occur.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TraceSourceWrapper class, using the specified TraceSource for the source.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.ActivityScope
member.summary: Sets the correlation manager ActivityId for the life of the object, resetting it when disposed, and optionally logging activity messages.

remarks.para: The sequence of events follows the convention used in WCF logging.
When created, the object logs a Transfer event, changes the ActivityId, and then logs a Start event.
When disposed, the object logs a Transfer event (back to the original), a Stop event, and then changes the ActivityId (back to the original).

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ActivityScope.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Sets the ActivityId for the life of the object without logging any events.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ActivityScope.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.TraceSource)
member.summary: Constructor. Sets the ActivityId for the life of the object, logging events but without specific event ID's.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ActivityScope.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.TraceSource,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. Sets the ActivityId for the life of the object, logging events with the specified event ID's.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ActivityScope.#ctor(Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.ITraceSource)
member.summary: Constructor. Sets the ActivityId for the life of the object, logging events but without specific event ID's.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ActivityScope.#ctor(Essential.Diagnostics.Abstractions.ITraceSource,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. Sets the ActivityId for the life of the object, logging events with the specified event ID's.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ActivityScope.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the object, resetting the ActivityId.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ActivityScope.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose of the object, resetting the ActivityId.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.ColoredConsoleTraceListener
member.summary: Trace listener that outputs to the console in color, optionally using a custom formatting template.

remarks.para: The initializeData for the ColoredConsoleTraceListener should contain a boolean (true/false) value indicating whether to use the Console.Error stream. The default is false, that is to use the normal Console.Out stream.
Note that colored output is only used in the normal stream; it is not used in the error stream.
The following attributes can be set when adding the trace listener entry in the configuration file.

item.value: false (default) to use the Console.Out stream; true to use Console.Error
Template to use to format trace messages. The default format is "{Source} {EventType}: {Id} : {Message}". For more information on the template tokens available, .

If false (default), then calls to , and similar methods are output directly to the output stream (using the Verbose color). If true, then calls to these methods are instead converted to Verbose trace events and then output using the same format as calls to Trace methods.
Color to use for events. The default color for fatal events is .
Color to use for events. The default color for errors is .
Color to use for events. The default color for warnings is .
Color to use for events. The default color for information events is .
Color to use for events. The default color for verbose messages is .

Color to use for activity tracing (start, stop, transfer, etc) events, unless overridden by a particular color for the specific activity event. The default color for activity tracing events is , the same as information events.
Color to use for events.
Color to use for events.
Color to use for events.
Color to use for events.
Color to use for events.

remarks.para: Valid color values are those from the enumeration.
When selecting colors note that PowerShell redefines DarkYellow and DarkMagenta and uses them as default colors, so best to to avoid those two colors because result is not consistent.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase
member.summary: Trace listener that forwards all calls to a single template method, allowing easy implementation of custom trace listeners.

remarks.para: This trace listener is designed to allow easy creation of custom trace listeners by inheriting from this class and implementing a single template method, WriteTrace.
The WriteTrace method combines all the various combinations of trace methods from the base TraceListener class, passing the full details to the template method allowing structured logging.
By default the write methods are also converted to Verbose trace events, allowing them to also be logged in a structured manner.
If implementing a stream-based listener, then the default template methods for Write and WriteLine can also be overridden to provide behaviour similar to stream-based listeners in the .NET Framework.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor used when creating from config file. (The Name property is set after the TraceListener is created.)

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor used when creating dynamically in code. The name should be set in the constructor.
member.param: Name of the trace listener.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.Close
member.summary: Closes the listener so it no longer receives tracing or debugging output.

remarks.para: The default implementation calls Flush().

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.TraceData(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the trace data to the listener output, if allowed by the configured filter. The data is forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.TraceData(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes the trace data to the listener output, if allowed by the configured filter. The data is forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.TraceEvent(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the event to the listener, if allowed by the configured filter. The event is forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.TraceEvent(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes the event to the listener, formatting the message with the provided arguments, but only if allowed by the configured filter. The event is forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

remarks.para: For performance reasons the message is not formatted, and the args not converted to strings, unless the filter is first passed.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.TraceTransfer(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary: Writes the transfer to the listener, if allowed by the configured filter. The transfer is forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.Write(System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the object to the listener. The object is forwared to the Write template method as data, which by default is then forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.Write(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the object to the listener with the specified category. The object is forwared to the Write template method as data, which by default is then forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the message to the listener. The message is forwared to the Write template method, which by default is then forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.Write(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the message to the listener with the specified category. The message is forwared to the Write template method, which by default is then forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.WriteLine(System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the object to the listener. The object is forwared to the Write template method as data, which by default is then forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.WriteLine(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the object to the listener with the specified category. The object is forwared to the Write template method as data, which by default is then forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the message to the listener. The message is forwared to the Write template method, which by default is then forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.WriteLine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the message to the listener with the specified category. The message is forwared to the Write template method, which by default is then forwarded to the WriteTrace template method.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.Write(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Template method that by default forwards the written details to WriteTrace as a Verbose event this should be overridden to write direct to the output if using a stream.

remarks.para: The default implementation converts the writen details to a Verbose event which is forwarded to WriteTrace for output.

The category is prepended to any message with a separating colon (:), which is similar to the format used by framework listeners. The data object is traced as data, which usually means it is also eventually output as text, but usually in a different field. If category is specified when tracing a data object, the category is treated as the message (without any colon).
If the listener is using a stream based output, then usually the Write and WriteLine methods should be overridden to output directly to the stream (with a following newline in the case of WriteLine).

Listeners should also consider supporting a ConvertWriteToEvent property, which if set calls this base implemention, allowing the user to choose if Write and WriteLine should be output directly or treated as events (and formatted accordingly).
Listeners that do not use a continuous stream based output, but use specifically formatted output, should leave this default implementation and simply override WriteTrace.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.WriteLine(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Template method that by default forwards the written details to WriteTrace as a Verbose event this should be overridden to write direct to the output as a complete line (with a newline at the end) if using a stream.

remarks.para: The default implementation converts the writen details to a Verbose event which is forwarded to WriteTrace for output.

The category is prepended to any message with a separating colon (:), which is similar to the format used by framework listeners. The data object is traced as data, which usually means it is also eventually output as text, but usually in a different field. If category is specified when tracing a data object, the category is treated as the message (without any colon).
If the listener is using a stream based output, then usually the Write and WriteLine methods should be overridden to output directly to the stream (with a following newline in the case of WriteLine).

Listeners should also consider supporting a ConvertWriteToEvent property, which if set calls this base implemention, allowing the user to choose if Write and WriteLine should be output directly or treated as events (and formatted accordingly).
Listeners that do not use a continuous stream based output, but use specifically formatted output, should leave this default implementation and simply override WriteTrace.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceListenerBase.WriteTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object[])
member.summary: Template method that must be overridden to write trace to the listener output.

remarks.para: All of the parent interface of TraceListener is forwarded to this single template method including, by default, calls to Write and WriteLine methods.
This means when inheriting from TraceListenerBase only this single method needs to be overridden to implement a complete listener.
Listeners that use a continuous stream based output may also consider overridding the two Write and WriteLine template methods to provide direct writing behaviour, although this is not required.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.summary: Constructor with initializeData.

member.summary: Sets the console color to use for the specified event type.
member.param: The TraceEventType to set the color for.
The ConsoleColor to use for outputing trace messages of the specified type.

remarks.para: When selecting colors note that PowerShell redefines DarkYellow and DarkMagenta and uses them as default colors, so best to to avoid those two colors because result is not consistent.

member.summary: Allowed attributes for this trace listener.

member.summary: Handles trace Write calls - either output directly to console or convert to verbose event based on the ConvertWriteToEvent setting.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ColoredConsoleTraceListener.WriteLine(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Handles trace Write calls - either output directly to console or convert to verbose event based on the ConvertWriteToEvent setting.

member.summary: Gets or sets the console to use; this defaults to an adapter for System.Console.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.ColoredConsoleTraceListener.ConvertWriteToEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether calls to the Trace class static Write and WriteLine methods should be converted to Verbose events, and then filtered and formatted (otherwise they are output directly to the console).

member.summary: Gets or sets the token format string to use to display trace output.

remarks.para: See TraceFormatter for details of the supported formats.
The default value is "{Source} {EventType}: {Id} : {Message}", which matches ConsoleTraceListener.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.ColoredConsoleTraceListener.UseErrorStream
member.summary: Gets whether to use the error stream or the standard out stream.

remarks.para: This value is part of initializeData; if the value changes the listener is recreated.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener
member.summary: Sends a formatted email containing the contents of the trace.

remarks.para: Sends each trace message received in an email, using the specified subject and body templates.
It is strongly recommended to set a filter to only accept Warning and above errors, or otherwise reduce the number of trace events that are processed by this listener to avoid flooding.
Sending an email is an expensive operation, so messages are queued and sent on a separate thread. If there is a flood of messages exceeding the queue size then messages will be dropped.
The SMTP host settings are defined in MailSettings of app.config, as documented at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/w355a94k.aspx.
The following attributes can be set when adding the trace listener entry in the configuration file.

item.value: Email address of the recipient. Multiple recipients may be separated by commas.
Ignored.
Template used to construct the email body.
Optional alternate from address, instead of the one configured in system.net mailSettings.
Maximum concurrent SMTP connections. Default is 2 connections.
Maximum number of emails per hour that will be sent, to prevent flooding. Default is 50.
Template used to construct the email subject. For more information on the template tokens available, .

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Sends each trace event in an email to the specified address.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.GetSupportedAttributes
member.summary: Allowed attributes for this trace listener.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.WriteTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object[])
member.summary: Write trace event with data.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.BodyTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template used to construct the email body.

remarks.para: See TraceFormatter for details of the supported formats.
The default template includes the Source, Date (UTC and Local), Event ID, Level, Activity, User, Computer, AppDomain, Process ID, Process Name, Thread ID, Message (full) and Data.
Note if configuring in XML to use the entity escape sequence to encode new lines, " " (if setting in code, encode new lines with '\n' as normal).

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.FromAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets an alternate from address, instead of the one configured in system.net mailSettings.

remarks.para: Generally the value set in system.net mailSettings is used as the From address field in any email sent, however this attribute may be set to override the value.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the trace listener is thread safe.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.MaxConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum concurrent SMTP connections.

remarks.para: The default value is 2.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.MaxTracesPerHour
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of emails per hour that will be sent, to prevent flooding.

remarks.para: The default value is 50.

To prevent flooding with emails this listener has a maximum number of email messages it will send per hour. Normally the frequency of emails should be controlled by adding an appropriate filter, for example add an EventTypeFilter that only send messages of Warning level and above.

However there could still be an issue that causes repeated error events to be generated, which would result in a flood of emails. To prevent this the component drops any further traces once the limit is reached.
Note that restarting the process clears the counter and will send additional messages.
Setting the value to "0" will put no limit on the number of messages sent.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.SubjectTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template used to construct the email subject.

remarks.para: See TraceFormatter for details of the supported formats.
The default value is "{EventType} {Id}: {MessagePrefix}; {MachineName}; {User}; {Process}".

Note that the {MessagePrefix} inserts the trace message up to the first punctuation character with a maximum length of 40 characters. This keeps the email subject header short; the full message is included in the email body.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.EmailTraceListener.ToAddress
member.summary: Gets the email address the trace messages will be sent to.

remarks.para: This value is part of initializeData; if the value changes the listener is recreated. See the constructor parameter for details of the supported formats.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener
member.summary: Adds formatted trace messages to a buffer and sends an email when the process exits, or on request.

remarks.para: Intended to be used in console apps which will send all warning/error traces via email at the end of the process.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Adds each trace to a buffer and then sends an email to the specified address with all buffered messages when the process exits, or on request.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.Clear
member.summary: Clears all buffered messages.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.ClearAll
member.summary: Clears the buffer for all BufferedEmailTraceListener attached to Trace.

remarks.para: Note that this does not clear listeners that are only attached to a TraceSource, they must be attached to the main Trace entry as well.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.Send
member.summary: Send all trace messages in buffer in a single email message. If the buffer is empty, no email is sent.

remarks.para: The buffer is then cleared.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.SendAll
member.summary: Send all buffered messages for all listeners attached to Trace.

remarks.para: While the listener will send an email message at the end of the hosting process, this function will allow your application code to send the email message earlier. For example, you might want to send one message at the end of each loop.
Note that this does not clear listeners that are only attached to a TraceSource, they must be attached to the main Trace entry as well.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.GetSupportedAttributes
member.summary: Allowed attributes for this trace listener.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.WriteTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object[])
member.summary: Write trace event with data.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.FromAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets an alternate from address, instead of the one configured in system.net mailSettings.

remarks.para: Generally the value set in system.net mailSettings is used as the From address field in any email sent, however this attribute may be set to override the value.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template used to construct the header of the email body.

remarks.para: See TraceFormatter for details of the supported formats.

The default template includes the Date (UTC and Local), User, Computer, AppDomain, Process ID, and Process Name. The details used are based on the first trace received, so should be used for information that will be consistent or meaningful for all traces.
The rest of the body of the email then contains the buffered messages using TraceTemplate (including the buffered first message in the TraceTemplate format).
Note if configuring in XML to use the entity escape sequence to encode new lines, " " (if setting in code, encode new lines with '\n' as normal).

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the trace listener is thread safe.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.MaxConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum concurrent SMTP connections.

remarks.para: The default value is 2.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.SubjectTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template used to construct the email subject.

remarks.para: See TraceFormatter for details of the supported formats.

The default value is "{Listener} {DateTime:u}; {MachineName}; {User}; {Process}", and uses details from the first trace received, so should contain information that will be consistent or meaningful for all traces.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.ToAddress
member.summary: Gets the email address the trace messages will be sent to.

remarks.para: This value is part of initializeData; if the value changes the listener is recreated. See the constructor parameter for details of the supported formats.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.BufferedEmailTraceListener.TraceTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for a single trace message.

remarks.para: See TraceFormatter for details of the supported formats.
The default value is "{DateTime:u} [{Thread}] {EventType} {Source} {Id}: {Message}{Data}", which is also the format used in RollingFileTraceListener.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.ExpressionFilter
member.summary: Trace filter that evaluates a user-supplied boolean expression.

remarks.para: The initalizeData for the filter contains the C# expression that is evaluated. The expression must return a boolean result and can use any of the parameters: Source, EventType, Id, Format, Callstack, DateTime, LogicalOperationStack, ProcessId, ThreadId, Timestamp.
You can also use an C# expression, including accessing environment details. Note that expressions are case sensitive; the parameter names above must be cased correctly.
Note that Format is the format template or message (if there are no format parameters).

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ExpressionFilter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: A C# expression that is evaluated to determine if the event should be traced or not.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ExpressionFilter.ShouldTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[],System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Determines whether the event should be traced by the listener or not.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.ExpressionFilter.ExpressionBase
member.summary: Base class used internally by ExpressionFilter to compile dynamic methods. This class is not intended to be used outside this filter.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.ExpressionFilter.ExpressionBase.ShouldTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.DateTimeOffset,System.Collections.Stack,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Evaluates the filter expression to determine if an event should be traced.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.PropertyFilter
member.summary: Trace filter that filters based on the value of a property.

remarks.para: The initializeData for this filter contains a single property comparison, e.g. initializeData="Id == 1".

Currently only equality is supported, using C# syntax (double equals signs). The property must come first and must be one of the values: Data, Data0, EventType, Id, Message, ActivityId, RelatedActivityId, Source, Callstack, DateTime, LogicalOperationStack, ProcessId, ThreadId, Timestamp, MachineName, ProcessName, ThreadName.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.PropertyFilter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.PropertyFilter.ShouldTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[],System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Determines whether the event should be traced by the listener or not.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener
member.summary: Trace listener that writes to a text file, rolling to a new file based on a filename template (usually including the date).

remarks.para: A rolling log file is achieved by including the date in the filename, so that when the date changes a different file is used.

Available tokens are DateTime (a UTC DateTimeOffset) and LocalDateTime (a local DateTimeOffset), as well as ApplicationName, ProcessId, ProcessName and MachineName. These use standard .NET format strings, e.g. "Trace{DateTime:yyyyMMddTHH}.log" would generate a different log name each hour.

The default filePathTemplate is "{ApplicationName}-{DateTime:yyyy-MM-dd}.log", which matches the format used by Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener (except that it uses UTC time instead of local time).

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Writes to a rolling text file using the default name.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor with initializeData.
member.param: Template filename to log to; may use replacement parameters.

remarks.para: A rolling log file is achieved by including the date in the filename, so that when the date changes a different file is used.

Available tokens are DateTime (a UTC DateTimeOffset) and LocalDateTime (a local DateTimeOffset), as well as ApplicationName, ProcessId, ProcessName and MachineName. These use standard .NET format strings, e.g. "Trace{DateTime:yyyyMMddTHH}.log" would generate a different log name each hour.

The default filePathTemplate is "{ApplicationName}-{DateTime:yyyy-MM-dd}.log", which matches the format used by Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener (except that it uses UTC time instead of local time).
To get behaviour that exactly matches FileLogTraceListener, use "{ApplicationName}-{LocalDateTime:yyyy-MM-dd}.log".

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the output buffer.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.GetSupportedAttributes
member.summary: Allowed attributes for this trace listener.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.Write(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Handles trace Write calls - either output directly to console or convert to verbose event based on the ConvertWriteToEvent setting.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.WriteLine(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Handles trace Write calls - either output directly to console or convert to verbose event based on the ConvertWriteToEvent setting.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.WriteTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object[])
member.summary: Write trace event with data.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.ConvertWriteToEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether calls to the Trace class static Write and WriteLine methods should be converted to Verbose events, and then filtered and formatted (otherwise they are output directly to the file).

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.FileSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets the file system to use; this defaults to an adapter for System.IO.File.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Gets whether the listener internally handles thread safety (or if the System.Diagnostics framework needs to co-ordinate threading).

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.Template
member.summary: Gets or sets the token format string to use to display trace output.

remarks.para: See TraceFormatter for details of the supported formats.
The default value is "{DateTime:u} [{Thread}] {EventType} {Source} {Id}: {Message}{Data}".

To get a format that matches Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener, use the tab delimited format "{Source} {EventType} {Id} {Message}{Data}". (Note: In the config XML file the TAB characters are XML encoded; if specifying in C# code the delimiters would be '\t'.)

To get a format matching FileLogTraceListener with all TraceOutputOptions enabled, use "{Source} {EventType} {Id} {Message} {Callstack} {LogicalOperationStack} {DateTime:u} {ProcessId} {ThreadId} {Timestamp} {MachineName}".
To get a format simliar to that produced by System.Diagnostics.TextWriterTraceListener, use "{Source} {EventType}: {Id} : {Message}{Data}".

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingFileTraceListener.FilePathTemplate
member.summary: Gets the template for the rolling file name.

remarks.para: This value is part of initializeData; if the value changes the listener is recreated. See the constructor parameter for details of the supported formats.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener
member.summary: Trace listener that writes E2ETraceEvent XML fragments to a text file, rolling to a new file based on a filename template (usually including the date).

remarks.para: The E2ETraceEvent XML fragment format can be read by the Service Trace Viewer tool.
A rolling log file is achieved by including the date in the filename, so that when the date changes a different file is used.

Available tokens are DateTime (a UTC DateTimeOffset) and LocalDateTime (a local DateTimeOffset), as well as ApplicationName, ProcessId, ProcessName and MachineName. These use standard .NET format strings, e.g. "Trace{DateTime:yyyyMMddTHH}.svclog" would generate a different log name each hour.

The default filePathTemplate is "{ApplicationName}-{DateTime:yyyy-MM-dd}.svclog", which matches the format used by Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener (except that it uses UTC time instead of local time).

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Writes to a rolling text file using the default name.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor with initializeData.
member.param: Template filename to log to; may use replacement parameters.

remarks.para: A rolling log file is achieved by including the date in the filename, so that when the date changes a different file is used.

Available tokens are DateTime (a UTC DateTimeOffset) and LocalDateTime (a local DateTimeOffset), as well as ApplicationName, ProcessId, ProcessName and MachineName. These use standard .NET format strings, e.g. "Trace{DateTime:yyyyMMddTHH}.svclog" would generate a different log name each hour.

The default filePathTemplate is "{ApplicationName}-{DateTime:yyyy-MM-dd}.svclog", which matches the format used by Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener (except that it uses UTC time instead of local time).
To get behaviour that exactly matches FileLogTraceListener, use "{ApplicationName}-{LocalDateTime:yyyy-MM-dd}.svclog".

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the output buffer.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener.GetSupportedAttributes
member.summary: Allowed attributes for this trace listener.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener.WriteTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object[])
member.summary: Write trace event with data.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener.FileSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets the file system to use; this defaults to an adapter for System.IO.File.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Gets whether the listener internally handles thread safety (or if the System.Diagnostics framework needs to co-ordinate threading).

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.RollingXmlTraceListener.FilePathTemplate
member.summary: Gets the template for the rolling file name.

remarks.para: This value is part of initializeData; if the value changes the listener is recreated. See the constructor parameter for details of the supported formats.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.InMemoryTraceListener
member.summary: Records trace events in memory, within a circular buffer. The buffer limit can be set by the initialization data.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.InMemoryTraceListener.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a listener with the default buffer size (20).

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.InMemoryTraceListener.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a listener with the specified buffer size.

member.summary: Clears the buffer.

member.summary: Gets an array of the current events in the buffer.

member.summary: Records the trace event in the in-memory buffer, converting mutable properties to string arrays to preserve their value at the time of the trace.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.InMemoryTraceListener.Limit
member.summary: Gets the current buffer size.

remarks.para: Note that the size of the buffer cannot be changed once the listener has been created. If the initialization data is changed, a new instance of the listener is created, i.e. existing data will be lost.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.InMemoryTraceListener.IsThreadSafe

member.name: T:Essential.IO.FileSystem
member.summary: Adapter that wraps System.IO.File and System.IO.Directory, allowing them to be substituted.

member.name: T:Essential.IO.IFileSystem
member.summary: Interface facade representing the file system and the operations of System.IO.File and System.IO.Directory.

member.name: M:Essential.IO.IFileSystem.Open(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare)
member.summary: Opens a System.IO.FileStream on the specified path, having the specified mode with read, write, or read/write access and the specified sharing option.
member.param: The file to open.
A value that specifies whether a file is created if one does not exist, and determines whether the contents of existing files are retained or overwritten.
A value that specifies the operations that can be performed on the file.
A value specifying the type of access other threads have to the file.

member.name: M:Essential.IO.FileSystem.Open(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare)
member.summary: Opens a System.IO.FileStream on the specified path, having the specified mode with read, write, or read/write access and the specified sharing option.
member.param: The file to open.
A value that specifies whether a file is created if one does not exist, and determines whether the contents of existing files are retained or overwritten.
A value that specifies the operations that can be performed on the file.
A value specifying the type of access other threads have to the file.

member.name: T:Essential.Resource
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.SqlDatabaseTraceListener
member.summary: Trace listener that writes to a database.

remarks.para: This listener writes to the database table created by the diagnostics_regsql tool (via the stored procedure created by the tool).
The following attributes can be set when adding the trace listener entry in the configuration file.

item.value: Name of the connection string of the database to write to.
Application name to use when writing to the database; set this value when the database is shared between multiple applications. The default value is an empty string.
Command to use when calling the database. The default is the diagnostics_Trace_AddEntry stored procedure created by the diagnostics_regsql tool.

Maximum length of the message text to write to the database, where the database column has limited size. Messages (after inserting format parameters) are trimmed to this length, with the last three characters replaced by "..." if the original message was longer.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.SqlDatabaseTraceListener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor with initializeData.
member.param: name of the connection string of the database to write to

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.SqlDatabaseTraceListener.GetSupportedAttributes
member.summary: Allowed attributes for this trace listener.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.SqlDatabaseTraceListener.WriteTrace(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object[])
member.summary: Write trace event with data.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.SqlDatabaseTraceListener.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application used when logging to the database.

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.SqlDatabaseTraceListener.CommandText
member.summary: Gets or sets the command, with parameters, sent to the database.

remarks.para: The default command text calls the diagnostics_Trace_AddEntry stored procedure, created by the diagnostics_regsql tool.

To bypass the stored procedure, you can directly insert by setting the command text to something like "INSERT INTO dbo.diagnostics_Trace ( ApplicationName, Source, Id, EventType, UtcDateTime, MachineName, AppDomainFriendlyName, ProcessId, ThreadName, Message, ActivityId, RelatedActivityId, LogicalOperationStack, Data ) VALUES ( @ApplicationName, @Source, @Id, @EventType, @UtcDateTime, @MachineName, @AppDomainFriendlyName, @ProcessId, @ThreadName, @Message, @ActivityId, @RelatedActivityId, @LogicalOperationStack, @Data )".

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.SqlDatabaseTraceListener.MaxMessageLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length to trim any message text to.

remarks.para: This is the maximum length of the message text to write to the database, where the database column has limited size. Messages (after inserting format parameters) are trimmed to this length, with the last three characters replaced by "..." if the original message was longer.
A value of zero (0) can be used to remove the message limit length, for example where the column has no limit on length (e.g. a column of type ntext).

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.SqlDatabaseTraceListener.ConnectionName
member.summary: Gets the name of the connection string that identifies the database to use.

member.name: T:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceFormatter
member.summary: Formats trace output using a template.

remarks.para: Uses the StringTemplate.Format function to format trace output using a supplied template and trace information. The formatted event can then be written to the console, a file, or other text-based output.

The following parameters are available in the template string: Data, Data0, EventType, Id, Message, ActivityId, RelatedActivityId, Source, Callstack, DateTime (or UtcDateTime), LocalDateTime, LogicalOperationStack, ProcessId, ThreadId, Timestamp, MachineName, ProcessName, ThreadName, ApplicationName, MessagePrefix, AppDomain.
An example template that generates the same output as the ConsoleListener is: "{Source} {EventType}: {Id} : {Message}".

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceFormatter.Format(System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object[])
member.summary: Formats a trace event, inserted the provided values into the provided template.
member.returns: A string containing the values formatted using the provided template.

remarks.para: Obsolete. Should use the overload that includes listener instead.

member.name: M:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceFormatter.Format(System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceListener,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object[])
member.summary: Formats a trace event, inserted the provided values into the provided template.
member.returns: A string containing the values formatted using the provided template.

remarks.para: Uses the StringTemplate.Format function to format trace output using a supplied template and trace information. The formatted event can then be written to the console, a file, or other text-based output.

The following parameters are available in the template string: Data, Data0, EventType, Id, Message, ActivityId, RelatedActivityId, Source, Callstack, DateTime (or UtcDateTime), LocalDateTime, LogicalOperationStack, ProcessId, ThreadId, Timestamp, MachineName, ProcessName, ThreadName, ApplicationName, PrincipalName, WindowsIdentityName.
An example template that generates the same output as the ConsoleListener is: "{Source} {EventType}: {Id} : {Message}".

member.name: P:Essential.Diagnostics.TraceFormatter.HttpTraceContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the context for ASP.NET web trace information.

member.name: T:Essential.StringTemplate
member.summary: Formats structured strings similar to a composite format string but using a template with named, rather than positional, arguments.

member.name: M:Essential.StringTemplate.Format(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Replaces named template items in a specified string with the string representation of a corresponding named object from the specified dictionary. A specified parameter supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.param: A template string (see Remarks).
A dictionary that contains named objects to format.
member.returns: A copy of template in which the template items have been replaced by the string representation of the corresponding objects from arguments.
member.exception: template is invalid, or one of the named template items cannot be provided (when the named key does not exist in the arguments IDictionary).

remarks.para: Note that argument names may or may not be case-sensitive depending on the comparer used by the dictionary. To get case-insensitive behaviour, use a dictionary that has a case-insensitive comparer.
For implementations where a user-supplied template is used to format arguments provided by the system it is recommended that arguments are case-insensitive.

member.name: M:Essential.StringTemplate.Format(System.String,Essential.StringTemplate.GetValue)
member.summary: Replaces named template items in a specified string with the string representation of a corresponding named object provided by the passed function. A specified parameter supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.param: A template string (see Remarks).
An function that supplies named objects to format.
member.returns: A copy of template in which the template items have been replaced by the string representation of the corresponding objects supplied by getValue.
member.exception: template or the getValue callback is null.
template is invalid, or one of the named template items cannot be provided (getValue returns false when that item is requested).

remarks.para: Note that argument names may or may not be case-sensitive depending on the comparer used by the dictionary. To get case-insensitive behaviour, use a dictionary that has a case-insensitive comparer.
For implementations where a user-supplied template is used to format arguments provided by the system it is recommended that arguments are case-insensitive.

member.name: M:Essential.StringTemplate.Format(System.IFormatProvider,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Replaces named template items in a specified string with the string representation of a corresponding named object from the specified dictionary. A specified parameter supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.param: An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
A template string (see Remarks).
A dictionary that contains named objects to format.
member.returns: A copy of template in which the template items have been replaced by the string representation of the corresponding objects from arguments.
member.exception: template is invalid, or one of the named template items cannot be provided (when the named key does not exist in the arguments IDictionary).

remarks.para: Note that argument names may or may not be case-sensitive depending on the comparer used by the dictionary. To get case-insensitive behaviour, use a dictionary that has a case-insensitive comparer.
For implementations where a user-supplied template is used to format arguments provided by the system it is recommended that arguments are case-insensitive.

member.name: M:Essential.StringTemplate.Format(System.IFormatProvider,System.String,Essential.StringTemplate.GetValue)
member.summary: Replaces named template items in a specified string with the string representation of a corresponding named object provided by the passed function. A specified parameter supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.param: An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
A template string (see Remarks).
An function that supplies named objects to format.
member.returns: A copy of template in which the template items have been replaced by the string representation of the corresponding objects supplied by getValue.
member.exception: template or the getValue callback is null.
template is invalid, or one of the named template items cannot be provided (getValue returns false when that item is requested).

remarks.para: Note that argument names may or may not be case-sensitive depending on the comparer used by the dictionary. To get case-insensitive behaviour, use a dictionary that has a case-insensitive comparer.
For implementations where a user-supplied template is used to format arguments provided by the system it is recommended that arguments are case-insensitive.

member.name: T:Essential.StringTemplate.GetValue
member.summary: Provides named argument values for the StringTemplate.
member.param: Name of the argument required.
Value of the argument, if it exists.
member.returns: true if the argument name is valid, i.e. the value can be supplied; false if the argument name is invalid (usually treated as an error)
